abstract.para: With the help of service pack migration, &suse; offers now a some interesting features for system administrators: simple command line tool, intuitive graphical user interface, rollback, and some more. This chapter explains how to do a service pack migration step-by-step.

sect1.title: Service Pack Migration Workflow
sect1.para: A service pack migration can be used by either &yast; or zypper. Regardless of the method, a service pack migration consists of the following steps:

The list of migration targets depends on products which you have installed. Depending on your use case and on the status of your system, it is possible to skip a service pack and, for example, upgrade from &slea;12 GA straight to &slea;12 SP2.

The list of migration targets available for your host will always be retrieved from the &scc; and depend on installed products and may change over time—which mean that, for example, migration from &slea;12 GA to SP2 may be possible for one host, but not possible for another one.

sect1.title: Migration with &yast; (Online Migration Tool)
sect1.para: In order to perform an service pack migration with &yast;, use the Online Migration tool. By default, &yast; does not install any packages from third-party repository. If a package was installed from a third-party repository, &yast; prevents packages from being replaced with the same package coming from &suse;.

step.para: Install the latest updates to get the Online Migration module.
Install the packages yast2-migration and their dependencies.
Restart &yast;. toms 2015-09-03: Is this really necessary? In this case, I assume it's better to restart YaST.
Start the Online Migration module from the System section in &yast;.
&yast; will show possible migration targets and a summary.
Select a migration target and proceed with Next.
In case the Online Migration tool offers update repositories, decide if you want them. It is recommended to proceed with Yes.

toms 2015-09-09: FATE#319140 If the Online Migration tool finds obsolete repositories coming from DVD or a local server, it is highly recommended to disable them. Old SCC or SMT repositories are removed automatically.
Check the summary and proceed with the migration by clicking Next. Confirm with Start Update.
After the successful migration restart your system.

sect1.title: Migration with Zypper
sect1.para: In order to perform an service pack migration with Zypper, use the command line tool zypper migration:

step.para: Install the packages zypper-migration-plugin and their dependencies.

step.para: By default, Zypper uses the option --no-allow-vendor-change which is passed to zypper dup. If a package was installed from a third-party repository, this option prevents packages from being replaced with the same package coming from &suse;.
